title: Prostatic Abscess Due to Dual Infection With Mycobacterium tuberculosis and Stenotrophomonas maltophilia.
abstract: Prostatic abscess as an isolated entity is an infrequent and extremely rare manifestation of genitourinary tuberculosis. We report a case of a middle-aged male with type 2 diabetes mellitus and hypertension who presented with persistent lower urinary tract symptoms and fever. Imaging revealed a multiloculated prostatic abscess. Pus culture grew
